message: Hello Bob, I'm Alice. I'm pleased to offer you the exclusive opportunity to acquire this valuable product. Given its unique features and potential, I'm initially proposing a price of $2,300,000.  I believe this represents a fair starting point for discussions, and I'm open to hearing your thoughts.
I appreciate your initial offer, Alice. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $1,800,000. I believe this is a more reasonable price, considering the market value and my budget.

Bob, thanks for your counteroffer. I understand your perspective, but $1,800,000 is significantly below what I can accept.  How about we meet in the middle at $2,000,000? This price reflects the true value of the product while still offering you a competitive advantage.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $2,000,000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I can only go up to $1,950,000. I believe this is a fair price, considering the product's value and my financial constraints.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to move closer to my price.  While $1,950,000 is tempting, I'm still looking for something closer to my initial offer. Would you consider $1,975,000?  This offer represents a significant investment on your part, but I believe the return you'll see will be well worth it.

Alice, I understand you're looking to get closer to your initial offer, but I'm still a bit hesitant to go above $1,950,000. I'm willing to make a final push, but I can only offer $1,920,000. I believe this is a fair price, considering the value I'll be getting and my budget constraints.
Bob, you're really close.  I appreciate your persistence in this negotiation.  How about we split the difference and settle on $1,945,000?  This is my final offer.

Alice, I appreciate your persistence, but $1,945,000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to make one last attempt to reach a mutually beneficial agreement. I can offer $1,900,000, but I'm not willing to go any higher. This is my final counteroffer.
